sentences.english: Porridge has also been in some films.
Before eating, will ask you to eat the cooked rice or porridge is the mother.
sentences.chinese: 在飯前，會問你要喫乾飯還是稀飯的那個人是母親。

sentences.english: Today, in class, I was sitting next to the guy that I fancy.
sentences.chinese: 今天，上課的時候，偶坐在了偶稀飯的葛格旁邊。

sentences.english: My mother eats porridge every day.
Eat the cake and the porridge together.
They gave him more porridge, and Morel, laughing, attacked a third bowlful .
sentences.chinese: 又給他送來稀飯，於是莫雷爾吃了第三碗。

sentences.english: I want to have some porridge.
He doesn't like onions, green tea or porridge.
sentences.chinese: 他不喜歡洋蔥，綠茶和稀飯。

sentences.english: Try a little porridge, which contains fibre and protein-rich oats.
sentences.chinese: 早餐可以喫一點含有纖維和豐富蛋白質的燕麥稀飯。

sentences.english: Can You Resist The Temptation of These Delicious Ice Cream?
sentences.chinese: 誘惑難擋的美味冰淇凌童鞋們，稀飯麼？

sentences.english: Did the twins have porridge and eggs for breakfast yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 這對雙胞胎昨天早飯喫的是稀飯和雞蛋嗎？

sentences.english: I often have fermented tofu with my morning congee.
sentences.chinese: 我早餐常喫稀飯配豆腐乳。

definition: rice ball (steamed rice formed into a ball and stuffed with various fillings)/onigiri (Japanese-style rice ball)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam
